snippet: A Unicef official says that with 1.25 million Syrians registered as refugees, “the needs are rising exponentially and we are broke.”
abstract: United Nations will soon have to start cutting off lifesaving aid to people fleeing war in Syria because exodus has far outstripped financial support from international donors.

byline.original: By NICK CUMMING-BRUCE and SEBNEM ARSU
byline.contributor: Nick Cumming-Bruce reported from Geneva, and Sebnem Arsu from Istanbul. Anne Barnard contributed reporting from Damascus, Syria; Hala Droubi from Dubai, United Arab Emirates; and Hania Mourtada from Beirut, Lebanon.

lead_paragraph: A Unicef official says that with 1.25 million Syrians registered as refugees, “the needs are rising exponentially and we are broke.”

headline.seo: U.N. Says Aid for Syria Refugees Is Running Out
headline.main: U.N. Says It Is Running Out of Money to Assist Wave of Refugees From Syria
headline.print_headline: U.N. Says It Is Running Out of Money to Assist Wave of Refugees From Syria

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
